author: @wion
title: US lawmakers, State Dept condemn vandalism of Swaminarayan temple in California - World News
text: US lawmakers, State Dept condemn vandalism of Swaminarayan temple in California Story highlights The Shri Swaminarayan Mandir Hindu Temple in Newark, California was vandalised with anti-India graffiti and the police are investigating the matter as a possible hate crime. The Shri Swaminarayan Mandir Hindu Temple in Newark, California was vandalised with anti-India graffiti and the police are investigating the matter as a possible hate crime. Several US lawmakers have condemned the vandalism of a Hindu temple in California that took place this week. The Shri Swaminarayan Mandir Hindu Temple in Newark, California was vandalised with anti-India graffiti and the police are investigating the matter as a possible hate crime. Taking to X, Rep Barbara Lee expressed her anger at the incident. trending now “I unequivocally condemn this attack on Swaminarayan Mandir Hindu Temple in California. Hatred in all forms cannot be tolerated. Those responsible must be held accountable,” she wrote on the social media platform. I unequivocally condemn this attack on Swaminarayan Mandir Hindu Temple in California. Hatred in all forms cannot be tolerated.— Rep. Barbara Lee (@RepBarbaraLee) Those responsible must be held accountable. [December 23, 2023] [×](https://www.wionews.com) Rep. Eric Swalwell also condemned the attack on his X account. “There is no room for hate and we must extinguish it wherever it presents,” he wrote. Join our State Department in condemning this attack on Bay Area Hindus. There is no room for hate and we must extinguish it wherever it presents.— Rep. Eric Swalwell (@RepSwalwell) [https://t.co/WPTRT8RbQP] [December 23, 2023] [×](https://www.wionews.com) Similarly, other leaders like Raja Krishnamoorthi, Ro Khanna and Shri Thanedar also expressed their condemnation of the “disgraceful act”. “I denounce such attacks of intolerance and call for a thorough investigation into this heinous crime,” wrote Shri Thanedar. Congressman Shri Thanedar's Statement— Shri Thanedar (@ShriThanedar) As the founder of the Congressional Hindu, Buddhist, Sikh, and Jain Caucus, I express my profound condemnation of the disgraceful act of vandalism committed against the Shri Swaminarayan Mandir in Newark, California. This desecration, marked… [pic.twitter.com/qt3CQ8iSf3] [December 23, 2023] [×](https://www.wionews.com) I strongly condemn the defacing of the Swaminarayan temple in Newark, California which is in my district. Freedom to worship is at the heart of American democracy. Those who committed this act of vandalism must be held accountable.— Ro Khanna (@RoKhanna) [December 23, 2023] [×](https://www.wionews.com) The defacing of the Swaminarayan temple in Newark, CA is despicable, and I strongly condemn it. I’m glad the community is rallying to the support of the mandir. We must stand united against bigotry in all its ugly forms. Those who did this vandalism must be held accountable.— Congressman Raja Krishnamoorthi (@CongressmanRaja) [December 24, 2023] [×](https://www.wionews.com) Earlier, the US State Department also condemned the vandalism in a social media post. "We condemn the vandalism of Shri Swaminarayan Mandir Hindu Temple in California. We welcome efforts by the Newark Police Department to ensure that those responsible are held accountable," the US State Department's Bureau of South and Central Asian Affairs said in a post. According to officers responding to the incident, it was a “targeted act”. The Consulate General of India in San Francisco strongly condemned the defacing of the temple. "We strongly condemn the defacing of SMVS Shri Swaminarayan Mandir at Newark, California with anti-India graffiti," the consulate posted on X. Watch: US: California Hindu temple defaced with Pro-Khalistani slogans "This incident has hurt the sentiments of the Indian community. We have pressed for quick investigation and prompt action against the vandals by the US authorities in this matter," the Consulate said. According to images available on social media, the word “Khalistan” was sprayed on a signpost in the temple, along with other objectionable graffiti. (With inputs from agencies)

author: En réponse à
title: Macron nous entraine vers la guerre mondiale - François Asselineau - l'information nationaliste
text: "Larbin des États-Unis", "singe savant"... Le président de [l'UPR](https://www.upr.fr/), François Asselineau, n'a pas épargné Emmanuel Macron. Il faut dire que le président de la République (bananière) n'a de cesse de tendre le bâton pour se faire battre. En témoigne sa conférence de presse face à des journalistes complices, où il avait réponse à tout, n'était responsable de rien. Tous les sujets fondamentaux ont été éludés : explosion de la dette, effondrement du niveau de vie et surtout le risque de guerre mondiale dans laquelle il nous amène. Les armes continuent en effet à affluer vers l'Ukraine : Washington, Davos et Bruxelles l'ont décidé, Macron et Attal sont leurs obligés. Face au désespoir de millions de Français, agriculteurs en tête, François Asselineau en appelle au sursaut pour les européennes du 9 juin et invite les abstentionnistes à se mobiliser pour le Frexit, seule arme susceptible de faire sauter le Système oligarchique. [http://synthesenationale.hautetfort.com/archive/2024/02/01/macron-nous-entraine-vers-la-guerre-mondiale-francois-asseli-6483172.html](http://synthesenationale.hautetfort.com/archive/2024/02/01/macron-nous-entraine-vers-la-guerre-mondiale-francois-asseli-6483172.html)

author: Jordi Landero
title: La DANA azota con fuerza los municipios del litoral occidental onubense
text: El paso de la DANA por la costa de Huelva, la más afectada en las últimas horas por las fuertes lluvias, ha dejado ya un total de 117 incidencias, siendo por el momento Punta Umbría, Aljaraque o los núcleos costeros de Nuevo Portil y El Rompido, ambos en el término municipal de Cartaya, algunos de los municipios más perjudicados por las fuertes lluvias y por el viento y las tormentas. Las precipitaciones más intensas se produjeron a primera hora de la mañana del viernes, momento en el que la Agencia Estatal de Meteorología (Aemet), mantenía activado el aviso rojo en todo el litoral onubense, el cual cambió a naranja a las 15:00 horas. Según Emergencias 112 Andalucía las incidencias más atendidas en los municipios costeros fueron anegaciones de calles, carreteras, sótanos, viviendas de planta baja y establecimientos, principalmente localidades como Cartaya, Aljaraque y Punta Umbría, aunque también con casos en Ayamonte e Isla Cristina, entre otros. Solo en Punta Umbría, según informó el Ayuntamiento en un comunicado, se registraron una veintena de incidencias durante el tiempo que duró el aviso rojo, la mayoría de ellas por inundaciones de sótanos y garajes, principalmente en calles de las barriadas de San Sebastián y Poetas Andaluces. No obstante, la zona más afectada en dicho término municipal fue El Rincón, donde se desbordó un arroyo, donde más de una veintena de menores que celebraba una fiesta de Halloween en una casa de campo permanecieron incomunicados, aunque fuera de peligro, al estar el camino de acceso instransitable y por el corte de la carretera A-497 entre Huelva y Punta Umbría. Dicha incidencia tuvo que ser resuelta por efectivos del Consorcio Provincial de Bomberos de Huelva. Según la Diputación de Huelva, en municipios como Aljaraque se llegaron a registrar hasta 150 litros por metro cuadrado en los peores momentos del temporal, dándose \"circunstancias similares\" en Cartaya, Gibraleón o Punta Umbría. Por su parte, el Consorcio Provincial de Bomberos atendió un total de 58 incidencias en poco más de doce horas, siendo la Costa Occidental y el área metropolitana las zonas más afectadas, sobre todo por inundaciones. Entre las incidencias más destacadas resaltar en Aljaraque el rescate por bomberos del parque de Punta Umbría de una vecina en plena madrugada, la cual se había refugiado en el tejado de su vivienda al verse atrapada por el elevado nivel del agua. La intervención se produjo a las 5:04 horas de este viernes, con la intervención de tres efectivos y dos vehículos. También han tenido que actuar bomberos del Consorcio en el achique de agua de calles en Aljaraque, con garajes y algunas viviendas parcialmente afectadas, en El Rincón (Punta Umbría), en Gibraleón, y en el garaje del establecimiento hotelero Nuevo Portil Golf, en Nuevo Portil (Cartaya). En Punta Umbría e Isla Cristina han tenido que intervenir igualmente por inundaciones y realizar inspecciones en locales y garajes. En el caso de Cartaya, donde la peor parte de los efectos de las intensas lluvias de las últimas horas ha sido para sus núcleos costeros, permanecieron temporalmente interrumpidos al tráfico algunos tramos de las carreteras A-5053 (Cartaya – El Rompido) y A-5052 (El Rompido – Nuevo Portil), según ha informado el Consistorio cartayero, que también ha precisado que se han registrado en este municipio hundimientos e inundaciones en distintas calzadas. DADO DE ALTA EL HERIDO EN ISLA CRISTINA POR EL TORNADO DE LA TARDE DEL JUEVES En Isla Cristina, donde en la tarde del jueves se registró un tornado que atravesó el casco urbano de dicho municipio de sur a norte, arrasando todo lo que se encontró a su paso, ha sido este viernes dado de alta el trabajador municipal que resultó herido al caerle en una pierna parte de la cristalera de la Piscina Municipal, la cual reventó por el impacto de dicho fenómeno meteorológico. Ya por la noche, y sobre todo a primera hora del viernes, según ha informado el Ayuntamiento las intensas lluvias registradas, especialmente a primera hora de la mañana se saldaron con inundaciones y bolsas de agua en distintos puntos del municipio, especialmente en la urbanización de Urbasur, donde tuvieron que intervenir efectivos de Protección Civil, del Consorcio de Bomberos y de la empresa pública Giahsa, que desplazó hasta la zona equipos especializados en el achique de agua.

author: Ejikeme Omenazu
title: Apostle Akinyemi Leads Gospel Ministers To Ilase Ijesa For Annual Crusade  | Independent Newspaper Nigeria
text: Apostle Akinyemi Leads Gospel Ministers To Ilase Ijesa For Annual Crusade LAGOS – The three-day annual crusade that is held every December was different this year. This year’s theme was ‘Arise and Shine’. It started on Thursday December 28, 2023 and ended Saturday December 30, 2023 under the leadership of Apostle Dr. Bolaji Akinyemi, President of Voice of His Words Ministries Nigeria and Overseas. The crusade started at 4.pm each day. Signs of a success of the programme began to manifest on Tuesday December 26 when a crusade rally was observed. It witnessed a long train consequently the massive turnout of people from nooks and crannies of Obokun local government for the Crusade was expected. On the first day, Thursday December 28, the crusade started at about 4.15pm with CAN members, church choristers and Christian leaders from Ilase and environs all clad in their customised T-shirt for the programme. Also in attendance at the opening are Chiefs and Obas in and around Ilase. In his opening speech, the Convener introduced the Guest Minister’s in attendance and urged the indigenes to encourage the project and be prayerful towards the progress of the town and Ijeshaland. The preacher and the guest minister for the day, Ven. Blessing Ajayi, after his sermon, to pray for the town. Olaniyi Fadipe of the ‘Ijinle ninu Ijinle’ fame was the guest song minister on the first day. On the second day, December 29, the programme started at about 4.pm with the host choristers ministering, followed by prayers from various ministers to God to heal the land. The guest artist for the evening, sensational Ijobukky Gospel Bata, brought everyone out of their houses. The Hausa community could not resist the glamour of Bata Gospel and the traditional stepping that goes with it. Dynamic Dr Bolaji O. Akinyemi and the pragmatic Local Organising Committee had no problem responding to the need of the moment as they got someone to interpret in Hausa to the delight of the crowd. The guest minister, Pastor Olaitan Aromolaran, from Lagos used his sermon to encourage and shower blessings on everyone in attendance and in the diaspora. The third day, December 30, 2023, marked the grand finale and it was a great success as it witnessed massive turnout of greater numbers than the previous days. Seyi Crown a popular music artiste of the evening, while a renowned man of God, Prof. Peter Adeniyi Olowoporoku, an indigenes of Ile-Ife and a frontline Gospeller, thrilled the congregation with his different modes of preaching and prophetic declaration. Hitherto, the day was blessed and memorable. In attendance were the Chiefs and Dignitaries from Ilase-Ijesa. The Alase of Ilase-Ijesa, Oba Isiaka Adesina, Ajarabiolu, Odundun Asoludero 11, also graced the Crusade. Apostle Bolaji O. Akinyemi assured the Kabiyesi of developmental strides between the 2023 and the 2024 crusade, even as he led the audience to pray for a university and at least four cottage industries. Participants at the crusade admitted that this event was the best in many years. They talked of the state-of-art equipment used at the venue.

author: P.L.
title: Affaire Bétharram: l'Église déplore "des faits graves" et appelle à ce que le "silence soit levé"
text:
L'Église estime que les faits sont "en contradiction totale avec l'esprit de l'enseignement catholique". Une première réaction. L'Église déplore "des faits graves", "en contradiction totale avec l'esprit de l'enseignement catholique", dans un communiqué publié jeudi 21 février à propos de l'affaire des violences physiques et sexuelles au sein de l'établissement catholique Notre-Dame-de-Bétharram, dans les Pyrénées-Atlantiques.
Dans ce communiqué, la Conférence des évêques de France ajoute vouloir que "le silence soit levé sur tous faits de violence, d’agressions sexuelles ou toutes pratiques disciplinaires maltraitantes".
>> Plus d'information à venir sur BFMTV.com.
P.L. avec AFP

author: Spencer Hulse
title: The Golden Opportunity of Dropshipping
text:
The
e-commerce industry and online shopping have been booming in recent years — this is no secret. Any conversation about the growth of e-commerce and online shopping must also include the growth of dropshipping.
According to the data analysis firm Statista, the e-commerce market is
expected to reach US$7.4 trillion in the next four years. Statista also forecasts that the overall market value of dropshipping will grow to US$476.1 billion by 2026.
To learn more about what dropshipping is exactly today and the potential of this fast-growing e-commerce segment, we recently spoke with Lior Pozin, the co-founder and CEO of dropshipping platform provider
AutoDS.
“E-commerce is currently in its prime, and there is now a golden opportunity for dropshippers to leverage the boom in online shopping, mostly thanks to automation tools, to scale their businesses and increase profits,” said Pozin.
What Is Dropshipping?
Dropshipping is an e-commerce business model in which sellers do not keep products in stock. Instead, the sellers work directly with suppliers. When a customer places an order, the dropshipper then purchases the item from a third-party supplier, who in turn sends the product directly to the customer.
For example, a dropshipper could sell an item for $150 from a supplier that has priced the product at $100. From this sale, the dropshipper earns a solid profit of $50.
“In dropshipping, the seller is acting as a middleman in the order fulfillment process,” explained Pozin.
Since the dropshipping model does not require sellers to stock inventory, e-commerce entrepreneurs can get involved in dropshipping and launch online stores with limited upfront capital investments.
“The dropshipping business model can be described as low-risk and high-reward, opening the door for dropshippers to make attractive profits with minimal investments,” added Pozin.
Differences Between Dropshipping and E-commerce
Inventory is the main difference between the new dropshipping and traditional e-commerce models. In a standard e-commerce model, sellers must purchase and store stock, which comes with significant expenses and ongoing risks. However, in the dropshipping model, the sellers work directly with the suppliers.
“In fact, dropshipping has evolved into an easier and hassle-free way of selling online,” stated Pozin.
He notes that dropshipping allows sellers to market as many different products as possible and expand their product catalogs. This is because dropshippers do not need to invest in inventory.
“Consequently, dropshippers can cater to different demands and a larger market,” said Pozin.
According to him, this makes the dropshipping business model easily scalable, allowing sellers to test and list more items easily. Without investing in the inventory, scaling a dropshipping business comes at less risk.
“The best way to scale a dropshipping business is with automation tools. Automation in dropping allows sellers to use marketing and customer service to increase sales,” recommended Poizin.
How to Start a Dropshipping Business
According to AutoDS,
starting a dropshipping business is not as complex as it may sound. The company recommends following a few general steps to ensure that dropshippers offer attractive products in an optimized store targeted at the correct audience:
- Step 1: Find sellable products
- Step 2: Choose suppliers
- Step 3: Select a selling platform
- Step 4: Import products to your store
- Step 5: Market your products
- Step 6: Manage order fulfillment
- Step 7: Provide excellent customer service
- Step 8: Automate your business for better success
A dropshipping business is full of ongoing, time-consuming processes and tasks. From spending hours finding the best products to sell to processing fulfillment orders, managing a
dropshipping business manually can be a laborious endeavor full of room for human error.
Pozin highlights that fully understanding the dropshipping model and how the processes work is key to running a successful dropshipping business. He further notes that access to product information and selling tools are required to generate significant profits.
“Dropshipping automation tools allow sellers to automate the entire dropshipping process. Automation allows dropshippers to save valuable time and reduce errors in any of the steps. Plus, by automating dropshipping processes, sellers can optimize their businesses and boost profits,” concluded Pozin.

author: Talker News
title: Why having a dirtier space station is better for austronauts' health - NewsBreak
text: By Stephen Beech The International Space Station is too clean and making it “dirtier” could improve astronauts' health, claims new research. They often experience immune dysfunction, skin rashes, and other inflammatory conditions while traveling in space. Now a new study, published in the journal Cell , suggests that such health issues could be due to the "excessively sterile" nature of spacecraft. Researchers from the University of California, San Diego , found that the International Space Station (ISS) has a much lower diversity of microbes compared to man-made environments on Earth. The microbes that are present are mostly species carried by humans onto the ISS, suggesting that the presence of more microbes from nature could help improve human health on board. Study co-first author Dr. Rodolfo Salido said: “Future built environments, including space stations , could benefit from intentionally fostering diverse microbial communities that better mimic the natural microbial exposures experienced on Earth, rather than relying on highly sanitized spaces." The research team worked with astronauts who swabbed 803 different surfaces on the ISS - around 100 times more samples than were taken in previous surveys. Back on Earth, the team identified which bacterial species and chemicals were present in each sample. They then created three-dimensional maps illustrating where each was found on the ISS and how the bacteria and chemicals might be interacting. The researchers found that, overall, human skin was the main source of microbes throughout the ISS. Chemicals from cleaning products and disinfectants were present throughout the station. The team also found that different “modules” or rooms within the ISS hosted different microbial communities and chemical signatures, and the differences were determined by the module’s use. For instance, dining and food preparation areas contained more food-associated microbes, while the space toilet contained more urine- and poo-related microbes and metabolites. Study co-first author Dr. Nina Zhao said: “We noticed that the abundance of disinfectant on the surface of the International Space Station is highly correlated with the microbiome diversity at different locations on the space station .” When the researchers compared the ISS to different human-built environments on Earth, they found that the ISS microbial communities were less diverse than most of the samples from Earth. They were also more similar to samples from industrialized, isolated environments, such as hospitals and closed habitats, and homes in urbanized areas. Compared to most of the Earth samples, the ISS surfaces were lacking in free-living environmental microbes that are usually found in soil and water. The research team says that intentionally incorporating these microbes and the substrates they live in into the ISS could improve the well-being of astronauts without sacrificing hygiene. The team compares their suggestion to the well-studied beneficial impacts of gardening on the immune system. Co-author Professor Rob Knight said: “There’s a big difference between exposure to healthy soil from gardening versus stewing in our own filth, which is kind of what happens if we're in a strictly enclosed environment with no ongoing input of those healthy sources of microbes from the outside." The research team hopes to refine their analysis to be able to detect potentially pathogenic microbes and signals of human health from environmental metabolites. They say that those methods could also help improve the health of people living and working in similarly sterile environments on Earth. Dr. Salido added: “If we really want life to thrive outside Earth, we can't just take a small branch of the tree of life and launch it into space and hope that it will work out. “We need to start thinking about what other beneficial companions we should be sending with these astronauts to help them develop ecosystems that will be sustainable and beneficial for all.” The post Why having a dirtier space station is better for austronauts’ health appeared first on Talker .

author: @gurufocus
title: Amedisys Reports First Quarter 2025 Financial Results | AMED Stock News
text:
- Net service revenue rose to $594.8 million, up from $571.4 million in Q1 2024.
- Net income attributable to Amedisys (
AMED,Financial) surged to $61.0 million from $14.4 million year-over-year. - Adjusted EBITDA increased to $68.8 million from $59.9 million in the previous year.
Amedisys, Inc. (AMED) reported robust financial results for the first quarter of 2025, with net service revenue climbing to $594.8 million, reflecting a $23.4 million increase from $571.4 million in the same period last year. This marks a 4.1% year-over-year revenue growth.
The company, which specializes in home health, hospice, and high acuity care, noted a substantial increase in net income attributable to Amedisys, which reached $61.0 million, or $1.84 per diluted share, compared to $14.4 million, or $0.44 per diluted share, in Q1 2024.
The financial performance was influenced by a notable $48.1 million gain on an equity method investment and $16.8 million in merger-related expenses. Despite these one-time factors, the adjusted metrics also showed positive growth. Adjusted EBITDA rose by 14.9% to $68.8 million from $59.9 million, while adjusted net income increased to $41.6 million, or $1.25 per diluted share, compared to $33.9 million, or $1.03 per diluted share, the previous year.
Amedisys continues to operate 519 care centers across 38 states, serving approximately 499,000 patients annually. The balance sheet remains strong with $284.9 million in cash and cash equivalents, aligning the company well for future challenges, including the ongoing merger discussions with UnitedHealth Group, which are facing some regulatory hurdles.

text: Friday, 5 April [Bonded by faith and love for Ukraine: How the Armenian community of Dnipro welcomed their church and rallied to defend the city in 2022 / Famous Ukrainian philanthropists built the Church of St. Gregory Lusavorich in the Dnieper.
